de.dennis_kempf.squidward

Interface Automaton

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ImmutableAutomaton

    public interface Automaton
    Automaton with a finite set of States and Transitions.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void enable()
      Enables the automaton.
      java.util.Optional<State> getCurrentState()
      Returns the current state of the automaton.
      State getInitialState()
      Returns the initial state of the automaton.
      java.util.Set<State> getStates()
      Returns the finite set of states this automaton may be in.
      java.util.Set<Transition<?>> getTransitions()
      Return this finite set of transitions this automaton may take.
      boolean isEnabled()
      Returns whether the automaton has been enabled.
      void post(java.lang.Object event)
      Adds the provided event to the processing queue.

    • Method Detail

      • getInitialState

        State getInitialState()
        Returns the initial state of the automaton. When enable() is first called, this will be the new state and its entry action will be invoked.
        Returns:
        initial state

      • getCurrentState

        java.util.Optional<State> getCurrentState()
        Returns the current state of the automaton. The current state may be undefined (optional will be empty) if the automaton has not been enabled yet or the automaton is currently executing a transition.
        Returns:
        current state

      • getStates

        java.util.Set<State> getStates()
        Returns the finite set of states this automaton may be in.
        Returns:
        set of available states

      • getTransitions

        java.util.Set<Transition<?>> getTransitions()
        Return this finite set of transitions this automaton may take.
        Returns:
        set of available transitions

      • isEnabled

        boolean isEnabled()
        Returns whether the automaton has been enabled. This method may return true, even if the initial state's entry action has not been executed yet.
        Returns:
        true, if enabled, otherwise false

      • enable

        void enable()
        Enables the automaton. The current state will be set to the initial state and the initial state's entry action will be queued for execution. This method may only be called, if the automaton has not been enabled yet.

      • post

        void post(java.lang.Object event)
        Adds the provided event to the processing queue. This method may only be called once the automaton has been enabled. TODO: Add documentation on transition mechanism
        Parameters:
        event - non-null
